questions.question: What is a multidimensional array?
options: An array with more than one dimension
An array that can hold functions
questions.correctAnswer: An array with more than one dimension

questions.question: What is the syntax to declare a 2D array in C++?
How do you access the element in the second row and third column of a 2D array?
The default value of uninitialized elements in a multidimensional array is:
Which of the following is true about multidimensional arrays?
options: They can have any number of dimensions
They can only have two dimensions
questions.correctAnswer: They can have any number of dimensions

questions.question: How do you initialize a 2D array?
What is the size of a 3D array declared as int arr[2][3][4]?
How can you pass a 2D array to a function?
options: By using a pointer to the first element
By passing the entire array by value
questions.correctAnswer: By using a pointer to the first element

questions.question: Which of the following is a valid way to loop through a 2D array?
What happens if you try to access an index outside the bounds of a multidimensional array?
